conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a golf movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
Based on your preference for golf-themed movies, here are a few recommendations:

- "The Seduction of Joe Tynan" (2014) stars Melvyn Douglas as Senator Joe Tynan. When a respected liberal senator finds himself in the unlikely situation of leading the opposition to a Supreme Court appointment, he must decide whether it is worth losing an old friend and fudging principles to make the necessary deals, as well as further straining his already part- time family life. 

- "Maleficent" (2014) stars Angelina Jolie Pitt as Maleficent. When a young princess is chosen by the king to marry him, she discovers that her new stepmother, Maleficent, has designs on her and wants to make sure that she never becomes a threat to Maleficent's plans for control. 

- "White Night" (2007) stars Samuel L Jackson as Jack Traven. When a young man named Jack Traver is killed in a car accident, his mother, Lily Traver, discovers that her son had been planning on running away from home after he graduates high school. As the police and authorities investigate the circumstances surrounding Jack Traver's death, they also become increasingly suspicious of Lily Traver's motives for having been involved in Jack Traver's death investigation.

- "The Sound of Music" (1965) - starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, and Buzworth. This classic musical is about a young woman who falls in love with a handsome man while they work together on a ship during World War II. You will enjoy the music, the dance numbers, and the performances by Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer, and Buzworth.
- "The Shawshank Redemption" (1994) - starring Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, and Bob Gunton. This powerful drama is about a young man who gets into trouble with a local gang after getting caught up in a group of young women who are out on a night of drinking at the local bar. You will enjoy the performances by Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, and Bob Gunton.
- "The Princess Bride" (1987) - starring Richard Kind, Elizabeth Shue, Daniel Day-Lewis, and Melinda Harris. This classic fantasy is about a young woman who falls in love with a handsome man while they work together on a ship during World War II. You will enjoy the performances by Richard Kind, Elizabeth Shue, Daniel Day-Lewis, and Melinda Harris.
- "Jumper" (2008) - starring Hayden Christensen, Claire Danes, John Forsythe, and Brian Cox. This action-packed science fiction is about a young man who has developed the ability to teleport himself from one location on Earth to another location on Earth in a relatively short amount of time. You will enjoy the action sequences, the special effects, the performances by Hayden Christensen, Claire Danes, John Forsythe, and Brian Cox.
- "It's A Wonderful Life" (1946) - starring Lionel Barrymore, Jean Arthur, Frank Faylen, Charles Laughton, and Harry Travers. This classic drama is about a young man who gets into trouble with a local gang after getting caught up in a group of young women who are out on a night of drinking at the local bar. You will enjoy the performances by Lionel Barrymore, Jean Arthur, Frank Faylen, Charles Laughton, and Harry Travers.

- Title: White Night (2007) | Plot: A pawnbroker is found murdered in a remote town. Police suspect that he was murdered by an acquaintance, as even the most experienced investigator on the case could identify no signs of resistance. Three people come under suspicion but all of them have perfect alibis and the investigation comes to a standstill. One year later, one of them is found dead and the original murder case becomes even more mysterious. Almost fifteen years pass and the lead inspector, now approaching retirement, reflects on the only case he could not solve in an otherwise successful career. Haunted by a sense for responsibility and guilt that he caused suffering by letting the murder case go unsolved, he decides to re-investigate.
